byline.contributor: Anne Barnard and Hwaida Saad contributed reporting.

abstract: Significant gains made by Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad's forces in Aleppo make it more likely than ever that Assad will survive uprising, even if victory will probably be Pyrrhic; brutality with which Assad has conducted campaign against uprising has left country economic wasteland, one that will still have low-level insurgency.

headline.print_headline: Assad’s Prize If He Prevails: Syria in Tatters
headline.main: For Bashar al-Assad, Winning the Syrian War May Lead to New Troubles

snippet: If the Syrian president defeats the rebels, he may preside over an economic wasteland hampered by a low-level insurgency and facing a challenge to find financial aid to rebuild....
lead_paragraph: If the Syrian president defeats the rebels, he may preside over an economic wasteland hampered by a low-level insurgency and facing a challenge to find financial aid to rebuild.
